New Records: India scored 297 for 6, the second-highest score in a T20I match, just 3 short of 300.
Sanju Samson scored 111, the second-quickest century in a T20I match.
Bangladesh's total of 164/7 was their biggest T20I defeat in terms of runs.
Key Match Events: Sanju Samson hit eight sixes and had a high control percentage for a strike-rate of 236.17.
Suryakumar Yadav contributed with crucial shots, including a six over backward point.
Riyan Parag and Hardik Pandya scored 81 runs off 31 balls, hitting four sixes each.
Mayank Yadav and Ravi Bishnoi were effective with the ball, with Bishnoi taking three wickets.
Post-Match Reflections: Sanju Samson celebrated his century with elaborate gestures, reflecting his confidence.
The match was a pivotal moment for India, showcasing their dominance in the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India hit 22 sixes and 25 fours, the most boundaries in a T20 innings for a Test-playing side.
18 overs went for ten runs or more, with one over having five sixes.
The match was the 100th meeting between India and Bangladesh.
Others: The article provided detailed stats and insights into the match, including player performances and team strategies.
